datafield.subfield: National Council for the Traditional Arts (NCTA) collection.
digital, WAV files (96 kHz, 24 bit and 44.1 kHz, 16 bit)
Recorded at various festivals, tours, concerts, and other events organized by the NCTA.

Collection of concert and workshop recordings of events at the National Folk Festivals, sponsored by the National Council for the Traditional Arts (NCTA), formerly the National Folk Festival Association founded in 1934, featuring performances of ballads, blues, bluegrass, contra dance music, country music, cowboy songs, fiddle tunes, folk music, gospel music, hymns, old-time music, singer songwriters, steel band music, storytelling, Western swing, and more; with numerous performers playing music from African, African American, American Indian, Cajun, Canadian, Caribbean, Eastern European, Hawaiian, Irish, Latin American, Mexican, Scottish, Sea Islands, Sicilian, Ukrainian, and many other traditions from throughout the United States and from around the world. Manuscripts include documentation from the containers of the original sound recordings.
National Council for the Traditional Arts (NCTA) collection (AFC 2001/019), Archive of Folk Culture, American Folklife Center, Library of Congress, Washington, D.C.
Collection is open for research. Access to recordings may be restricted. To request materials, please contact the Folklife Reading Room at
Collection includes digital preservation files from analog recordings.
Duplication of sound recordings may be governed by copyright and other restrictions.
National Council for the Traditional Arts;
In multiple languages, primarily in English.
American Indian Music and Dance Troupe,
Chaksam-Pa Tibetan Dance and Opera Company,
Mariachi Los Camperos de Nati Cano,
National Council for the Traditional Arts,
Archive of Folk Culture, American Folklife Center,
